title: U.S. Special Operations in Afghanistan since 2001
name: U.S. Special Operations in Afghanistan since 2001
description: This is a data set of U.S. Special Operations in Afghanistan since 2001  by Tara McKelvey imported from a Google Fusion Table

properties.notes: U.S. and allied forces came under small arms fire, then called in air support
properties.source: 6/18/02, "U.S. Troops Kill Two in Afghan Clash," Agence France-Presse

properties.what was employed: Soviet MI-17 helicopter; $3 million in suitcases
properties.notes: Bribed local warlords
properties.source: 02/03/2003, Time, "CIA's Secret Army"

properties.what was employed: War planes, photo-reconnaissance Canberra PR9 aircraft
properties.notes: Daylight raids; first time RAFs were used
properties.source: 10/10/01, The Citizen, "Fresh Daylight Raids on Taliban"

properties.notes: Two AC-130s hit a Taliban military complex near Kandahar; one of the first public accounts of U.S. Special Operations in the region
properties.source: 10/16/01, ABC News' World News Tonight Newscast, "Airplanes and Missiles Being Used in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Launch of raids marked first engagement of U.S. against Taliban
properties.source: 10/19/01, Financial Times (UK), "U.S. Elite Forces Start Ground War in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: First successful large scale night-time raid inside Taliban territory. Troops parachuted in and conducted operations taking out Taliban fighters
properties.source: 10/21/01, The Sunday Herald, "U.S. hails ground mission success; Video released after 180 paratroopers stage night raid in Taliban territory"

properties.notes: Radio shows were broadcast from Commando Solo aircraft
properties.source: 10/15/01, Aviation Week, "U.S. Stalks Taliban"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Forces worked with Northern Alliance to take over Taliban-run city
properties.source: 11/11/01, ABC News: World News Sunday, "Newscast;" 11/16/01, The Washington Post, "Taliban Under Assault"

properties.notes: Eight individuals, including two Americans, accused of preaching Christianity and held by Taliban for three months were rescued, and Special Operations soldiers took them to Islamabad
properties.source: 11/15/01, ABC New, "Newscast;" 11/15/01 Agence France Presse, "Aid Workers Rescued;" 12/10/01, A.P., "Aid workers jailed in Afghanistan;" 11/15/01, The Atlanta Journal-Constitution, "Aid Workers Rescued"

properties.notes: Friendly fire incident
properties.source: 08/11/03, CBS News, "Fog of War;" 12/6/01, The Sun,"Friendly Fire kills 3 US Troops"
properties.u.s. personnel killed: 23 Afghan fighters; 3 Americans: Sgt. Daniel Petithory, Master Sgt. Jefferson Davis, Sgt. Cody Prosser

properties.militants killed: Dozens of Al Qaeda fighters killed in air strikes
properties.notes: Osama bin Laden escaped from U.S. forces in the Tora Bora region
properties.source: 12/22/09, The New Republic, "The Battle for Tora Bora"

properties.what was employed: Enemy forces launched rockets, fired guns
properties.notes: Al Qaeda attacked an Afghan-U.S. base
properties.source: 12/29/01, Boston Globe, "Call for End to Afghan Bombing"

properties.notes: Over 100 Special Forces, mostly Army Rangers, targeted airstrip near Kandahar and a command center that Taliban leader Mullah Omar was believed to have used; officials said the soldiers "collected intelligence," implying they had taken prisoners; the operation was overseen from USS Kitty Hawk in Arabian Sea
properties.source: 10/21/01, Hindustan Times, "Commandos Hit Taliban Targets"

properties.notes: Special Forces set up road blocks on mountain highways, conducted ambushes of suspicious, and otherwise tried to intimidate bin Laden.
properties.source: 11/14/01, ABC World News Tonight, "Newscast: Report of Taliban members trying to strike bargains"

properties.notes: Soldiers and Marines attmpted to cut off Taliban and al Qaeda supply-and-escape routes
properties.source: 12/5/01, The Herald, "U.S. Marines begin search and destroy missions"

properties.notes: 100 Delta Force and 200 Rangers   carried out a humiliating retreat after suffering heavy casualties during their first raid on the Taliban
properties.source: 11/04/0, The Scotsman Sunday, "US Special Forces Fled After Raid Went Wrong" T

properties.notes: Americans attacked a  Taliban stronghold
properties.source: 5/13/02 Agence France-Presse, "U.S. Forces Raid Compound North of Kandahar, Killing 5"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Operations soldier was killed while on a mission to work with local tribes near Gardez and Khowst; his unit was ambushed.
properties.types of units: CIA Operatives, Green Berets, Delta Force
properties.source: 1/5/02, The Scotsman, "American soldier dies in ambush;" 1/7/02, CNN, "U.S. Special Forces soldier killed by hostile fire"

properties.notes: Forces capture 14 al Qaeda fighters, including two who were ranked high enough in the terrorist organization to be able to supply intelligence
properties.source: 01/09/02, The Macon Telegraph,"Pentagon: U.S. Forces Captured 14 Al-Qaida Fighters"

properties.notes: Special Forces sealed a key border crossing into Pakistan to keep tribesmen from bringing weapons into the country
properties.source: 01/12/02 Associated Press, "Special Forces to Hel Disarm Afghan Town"

properties.notes: Residents of the central Afghanistan village of Hazar Qadam, apparently raided by U.S . Special Forces, claimed that the 21 men who died and 27 captured were not Taliban; instead, they were working for  Afghan leader Hamid Karzai
properties.source: 1/28/02, The State, "Villagers Say Men Killed in U.S. Raid were Anti-Taliban Fighters"

properties.notes: U.S. special forces entered a hospital where up to 6 armed al-Qaeda fighters had been hiding since Taliban fled the city last year
properties.source: 1/28/02, Agence France-Presse, "U.S. special forces storm hospital in Kandahar"

properties.notes: Dropped oxygen tanks, but equipment shattered; one hospitalized boy died.
properties.source: At War With Ourselves (Oxford University Press), Michael Hirsh

properties.notes: Special Operations forces were part of Operation Anaconda - which was designed to take out a Taliban stronghold on Takur Ghar mountain.
properties.source: 05/24/04, Defense Department, "Executive Summary;" 5/6/02, The Times, "How Americans fell foul of al-Qaeda's last stand"

properties.notes: U.S. convoy searched two houses, dug up a garden and found three truckloads of weapons and ammunition left by the Taliban.
properties.source: 4/30/02, The Atlantic City, "U.S. Dents Taliban Supplies by Finding, Seizing Weapons"

properties.notes: Afghan forces, Special Operations troops and U.S. air support supported Coalition Forces in destroying a weapons cache as part of Operation Mountain Lion.
properties.source: 5/13/02, Belfast News Letter, "Al Qaida munitions dump blown up"

properties.notes: More than 10 people were in the aircraft Combat Talon when it crashed
properties.source: 6/12/02 Reuters News, "U.S. Special Operations Plane Crashed in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: U.S. forces returned fire when attacked and called in air support.
properties.source: 6/25/02, Agence France-Presse, "Mortars, rockets fired at U.S. special forces in eastern Afghanistan"

properties.notes: U.S. forces protected Afghan President Hamid Karzai and helped to train his bodyguards (after the assasination of vice-president Haji Abdul Qadir)
properties.source: 7/24/02 Financial Times,  "Afghan President to be Guarded by U.S. Special Forces"

properties.notes: Special Forces captured four men after several rocket-propelled grenades were fired at a U.S. special operations base
properties.source: 08/25/02 Record-Journal (Meriden, CT) "Coalition forces detain 16 in weapons sweeps"

properties.notes: Special Forces on patrol found mortar rounds, five rockets, and grenades for a rocket-propelled launcher in a partially collapsed cave as part of Operation Mountain Sweep.
properties.source: 08/25/02 Record-Journal (Meriden, CT) "Coalition forces detain 16 in weapons sweeps"

properties.notes: Suspected aggressor Mohammed Sayari was supposedly killed, but investigators later believed he was murdered by Special Forces on 01/06/06; criminal investigation was launched into "possible war crime"
properties.source: 01/06/05, Human Rights First, "Commander's Responsibility"

properties.notes: Man wearing an army uniform opened fire on President Hamid Karzai's car; special Operators shot and killed assailant
properties.source: 9/6/02, NBC News: Today, "Afghanistan president survives assassination attempt"

properties.what was employed: Guns, mortar rounds, A-10 Groundhog aircraft, bombs
properties.notes: Americans responded to mortar fire and called in air support
properties.source: 9/12/02, Western Morning News, "Rockets Fired at U.S. Soldiers"

properties.notes: Forces shot and killed an armed militant.
properties.source: 11/8/02, The Chanute Tribune, "U.S. Special Forces in Afghanistan Kill One Attacker"

properties.notes: One US Special Operations soldier was wounded in a rocket attack on a compound.
properties.source: 12/22/02, The Star-Ledger, "Afghan Battle Kills Sergeant"

properties.notes: Forces opened fire on 2 people while on patrol in a Taliban stronghold.
properties.source: 6/18/02 Agence France-Presse (AFPR) ,"US Troops Kill Two in Afghan Clash"

properties.notes: US investigators probed a bombing raid on a wedding party; Afghan authorities claim 48 people were killed; US only confirmed the forces had been led to an ammunitions and weapons cache by a AMF.
properties.source: 7/17/02, Agence France-Presse, "US investigators travel to Uzbekistan to probe wedding bombing"

properties.notes: US military supported Birtish-led "Operation Snipe" with air power and Speical Forces; operation sweeping mountains for Al Qeada operatives.
properties.source: 5/2/02, Coventry Evening Telegraph, "1,000 allied troops in key al Qaida area"

properties.notes: Special Operations seized a pile of Taliban documents found along with a major weapons cache (including 1,400 107mm rockets, 200 mines, 15 recoiless rifles and assorted small arms and ammunition) in a fundamentalist militia's former stronghold.
properties.source: 8/23/02, Agence France-Presse, "US forces seize stash of Taliban documents in former stronghold"

properties.what was employed: Air support, including one plane, at least a dozen choppers, Field Rockets
properties.notes: American Special Forces raided small farming village.
properties.source: 05/20/02, The New York Times, "Afghans Say 5 Killed in a U.S. Raid Were Farmers"

properties.notes: Reconnaisance
properties.source: 03/21/03, Herald-Sun, "Afghan Ambush"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Forces observing Afghan militia operations in  Kandahar province were attacked; they called in Apache helicopters and F-16s for air support
properties.source: 3/30/03, Agence France-Presse, "ISAF compound hit in Kabul rocket attack, no casualties reported"

properties.notes: Two U.S. Special Operations Forces members were killed and one critically wounded when their unit was ambushed by gunmen on motorcycle
properties.source: 3/30/03, Office of Congressman Charles B. Rangel, "Sgt. Orlando Morales"

properties.notes: A US Special Operations Forces unit recovered a cache of weapons near the eastern city of Jalalabad that included 33 cases of 14.5mm ammunition and 12 rifles; stockpiled for later use
properties.source: 5/23/03, Agence France-Presse, "US forces attacked in southeast Afghanistan"

properties.notes: A U.S. Special Operations Forces soldier was slightly injured by shrapnel when an explosive device detonated near his vehicle
properties.source: 5/22/03, Agence France Presse, "U.S. forces kill up to five in clash in southeast Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Vehicle was hit by remote controlled IED on roadside during border checkpoint reconnaissance
properties.source: 5/28/03, Agence France Presse, "U.S. Military Vehicle Hit by Afghan Bomb Blast"

properties.notes: A group of gunmen attacked a U.S. Special Operations Forces unit; the special operators survived
properties.source: 5/29/03, Agence France Presse, "U.S. troops attacked in southwest Afghanistan"

properties.notes: A U.S. Special Operations Forces vehicle was hit by a remote-controlled bomb; no one was injured
properties.source: 6/5/03, Agence France Presse, "Bomb blast hits U.S. convoy in southeast Afghanistan"

properties.notes: A U.S. Special Forces convoy was hit by a bomb blast while travelling in the province of Paktia
properties.source: 6/5/03, Agence France Presse, "Bomb blast hits U.S. convoy in southeast Afghanistan"

properties.notes: US Special Operations Forces found three Blowpipe surface-to-air missiles near a coalition base.
properties.source: 6/10/03, Agence France Presse, "US troops find Blowpipe missiles near base in eastern Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Two U.S. soldiers were wounded in an accidental explosion while training Afghan troops
properties.source: 3/8/03, Agence France Presse, "U.S. soldiers injured in accidental Afghan grenade blast"

properties.notes: A U.S. Special Operations soldier was killed while on combat operations in the Urgon district.
properties.source: 8/22/03, Agence France-Presse, "U.S.-led troops attacked in southeast Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Special Operations soldier died of injuries from falling during a night combat assault near Daychopan
properties.source: 8/30/03, Agence France-Presse, "U.S.-backed forces have killed at least 33 in Afghan fighting;" 9/1/03, The Independent, "U.S. soldiers killed in attack on Taliban"

properties.notes: US special operations forces and soldiers from the 10th Mountain Division, as well as close air support, had been involved in an 8-day offensive in overrruning Taliban positions in southern mountains in Operation Mountain Viper
properties.source: 9/3/03, Canberra Times, "Afghan, US forces move on Taliban hideouts;" 9/3/03, The Irish Examiner, "US planes bomb Taliban holdouts"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Operations Forces and aircraft were called in after militants attacked Afghan soldiers near coalition military base in Deh Rawood. American officials stated that the aircraft "expended ordnance on the enemy"
properties.source: 10/15/03, Agence France Presse, "Fighting continues as U.S. aircraft attack militants in central Afghanistan"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Operations forces and Afghan government troops fought against Taliban and al-Qaeda; two CIA operatives were killed during these operations
properties.source: 10/29/03, Xinhua, "2 U.S. agents killed in east Afghanistan"

properties.notes: One U.S. special operator died of wounds received during a gun battle with 10 to 15 members of the Taliban at the US-led Deh Rawood base.
properties.source: 11/5/03, Agence France Presse

properties.notes: Special operator was soldier died of injuries from an IED that hit a Humvee
properties.source: 11/14/03, Dow Jones International News, "U.S. Special Operations Soldier Killed In Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Following an attack on a US special forces convoy near Spin Boldak in Kandahar province, more than 2 dozen alleged Taliban fighters were killed in southern Afghanistan.
properties.source: Volume 58, Issue 1, Middle East Journal, "Chronology: Afghanistan;" 7/21/03, Agence France Presse, "Taliban increase attacks on US-led forces in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: One U.S. soldier was killed and two others were injured in a friendly-fire incident after their convoy was ambushed by the Taliban
properties.source: 4/24/04, Xinhua News Agency
properties.u.s. personnel killed: Patrick Tilman, Army Second Battalion,75th Ranger Regiment

properties.notes: Four U.S. Special Operations soldiers were killed when their vehicle hit a land mine
properties.source: 6/4/04, Agence France-Presse, "Thirteen suspected Taliban killed in southern Afghanistan"

properties.notes: US special-operations snipers killed nine suspected Taliban fighters.
properties.source: 3/7/04, The Independent, "Meanwhile, Task Force 121 steps up hunt for Bin Laden"

properties.notes: Rescue team's helicopter crashed
properties.source: 10/23/07, Virginian-Pilot, "Nation gives thanks;" 04/16/07, Daily News, "Navy SEAL"

properties.notes: Special operators chase militants across the border into Pakistan
properties.source: 07/25/10, The Guardian / Afghanistan War Logs, "U.S. Special Forces attack militants"

properties.notes: In a Canadian-led mission, British and U.S. Special Operations Forces fought the Taliban; NATO officials claimed later that the troops killed several hundred Taliban fighters
properties.types of units: NATO troops: Canadian, Danish and Dutch troops, British Special Operations
properties.source: 9/10/06, The Sunday Times, "Troops die as UK holds back Afghan reinforcements"

properties.notes: Delta Force soldiers intercepted Taliban member Osmani's satellite telephone call, and a U.S. airplane dropped a bomb on his vehicle; afterwards, the Taliban issued a statement that the bomb had instead killed Mullah Abdul Zahir, a district commander
properties.source: 12/24/06, The Sunday Times, "Taliban leader 'killed' after RAF tracks phone"

properties.notes: Afghans claimed that U.S. forces fired on civilians who were riding cars and walking along a six-mile stretch of road shortly after a Marine convoy was attacked by a suicide bomber; journalists who attempted to cover the story said U.S. troops took their cameras and deleted their photos and videotapes of the aftermath and warned them not to publish any images of the event
properties.source: 3/5/07, The Irish Examiner, "U.S. troops 'confiscated bomb attack photos'"

properties.notes: Marines shot at vehicles; Article 15-6 investigation started; April 2007: Afghan probe concluded Marines used excessive force
properties.source: 03/24/07, Washington Post, "Marine Unit Is Told To Leave Afghanistan;" 4/14/07, Agence France-Presse, "Afghan probe finds US used 'excessive force'"

properties.notes: Afghan and UN officials said about 50 civilians were killed on April 27 and 29 as U.S. special operators called in air strikes
properties.source: 5/18/07, Agence France-Presse, "NATO re-examines tactics amid Afghan civilian deaths"

properties.notes: U.S. forces hit the wrong target while in pursuit of Taliban leader
properties.source: 07/25/10, Guardian, "Afghanistan war logs"

properties.notes: U.S. targeted a compound of suspected Al Qaeda militants; US claimed the militants had been under surveillance and there were no signs of children present
properties.source: 6/18/07, NBC News: Nightly News, "U.S. forces kill insurgents, boys at safehouse in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Targeted senior Al Qaeda military commander, Abu Layith al Libi, but afterwards he was not found in the rubble
properties.source: 6/17/07, WikiLeaks, acessed via New York Times, "INCIDENT REPORT: Botched Night Raid"

properties.what was employed: 6  (guided bomb unite) GBU-31 (2000 lbs) precision guided munitions
properties.notes: Two senior Taliban commanders  were targeted while in the midst of a shura; the "target site" was destroyed
properties.source: 9/15/2010,  WikiLeaks, accessed via Guardian, Afghanistan War Logs, "Strike on meeting of Taliban leaders"

properties.notes: While pursuing Taliban commander, a U.S. special forces gunship fires at enemy
properties.source: 10/18/2010, WikiLeaks, accessed through Guardian, Afghanistan War Logs,"US special forces gunship shoots 15 police"

properties.notes: Army Master Sgt. Joseph D. Newell, 38, charged with murder
properties.source: 02/19/09, Associated Press, "Green Beret faces jury"

properties.notes: Sixty insurgents attacked after ambushing U.S. forces; Nunez awarded Silver Star posthumously
properties.source: 08/16/10, AP, "Special Forces;" 08/16/10, CNN

properties.notes: U.S. unit was pinned down; Sgt. 1st Class Jonathan Clouse awarded Silver Star
properties.source: 08/17/10, Fayetteville Observer, "Silver Stars for 7 Special Forces Soldiers"

properties.notes: Afghan soldiers learn skills at Camp Morehead
properties.source: 08/11/08, NPR, "U.S. Troops Train Afghans"

properties.notes: Freed a kidnapped civilian working for Army Corps Engineers
properties.source: 10/23/08 Agence France Presse, "Kidnapped American Freed in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Friendly fire incident
properties.source: 06/05/10, The Times (London), "Obama steps up "black ops'"

properties.notes: A team of Afghan National Army Commandos, advised by US Special Operations Forces, attacked a Taliban sanctuary freeing 16 locals in the stronghold established by a Taliban commander and destroying several Taliban weapons caches
properties.source: 8/13/08, Pajhwok Afghan News, "16 freed as rebel stronghold attacked;" 8/13/08, BBC Monitoring, "Sixteen freed as Afghan Taleban stronghold attacked"

properties.civilians killed: Dozens of Afghans, including women and children
properties.notes: U.S. air strike was misdirected
properties.source: 05/07/09, The Independent, "120 die as U.S. Bombs Village"

properties.civilians killed: 10 Afghan police, including Police Chief Matiullah Qati
properties.notes: Contractors attacked police officers; U.S. Special Forces denied responsibility
properties.contractors' involvement: 41 private guards employed by U.S. Special Forces
properties.source: 06/29/09, CBS, "Police Chief Dies;" 09/09, NYU, "Public Cost of Private Security"

properties.notes: Special operators allegedly mistreated teenagers Issa Mohammad, Abdul Rashid
properties.source: 11/28/09, Washington Post, "Two Afghans allege abuse;" 01/08/10, Washington Post, "U.S. military probing claims"

properties.notes: Helicopter mission kills 5 in raid. Villagers claim the dead were civilians
properties.source: 03/14/2009 Associated Press "5 killed in Afghan operation targeting bomb-maker"

properties.notes: Troops from the Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force  Afghanistan delivered gifts including toys, clothes and school supplies to a primary school
properties.source: 3/20/09, USFOR-A Public Affairs, "Special operations troops deliver smiles to Bagram schoolchildren"

properties.notes: A Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force-Afghanistan dental team at a Special Operations Forces clinic
properties.source: 4/15/09, USFOR-Afghanistan Public Affairs, "Dental team keeps mission going for SOF troops"

properties.notes: A Special Operations Forces team treated and medically evacuating 19 civilians
properties.source: 5/12/09, USFOR-A Public Affairs, "Special Operations Forces save lives after suicide bombers strike"

properties.notes: Afghan National Army Commandos with the 207th Corps, assisted by Special Operations Forces, killed five militants and wounded six others after a supply convoy was attacked
properties.source: 5/12/09, USFOR-A Public Affairs, "Afghan Commandos, Special Operations forces"

properties.notes: Afghan National Police, assisted by Special Operations Forces,  discovered a Taliban base camp in the Jani Kheyl District while conducting a combat reconnaissance patrol.
properties.source: 5/18/09, USFOR-A Public Affairs, "ANP, Special Operations Forces detain 7 insurgents"

properties.notes: Afghan National Security Force members, assisted by Special Operations Forces, provided medical treatment and provided humanitarian aid to villagers
properties.source: 5/18/09, USFOR-A Public Affairs, "ANP, Special Operations Forces"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Operations assisted Afghan and Dutch troops in a battle against the Taliban
properties.source: 6/11/09, Angence France-Presse, "Taliban killed in Afghan operations"

properties.notes: A Special Forces team teach local Afghan children four hours every day in a schoolhouse setting
properties.source: 7/22/09, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Special operations soldiers bring gift of education to Afghan children"

properties.notes: Forces conducted joint sweeps, recovering large caches of firearms
properties.types of units: Coalition Troops, Afghan National Army Troops
properties.source: 08/0/10, Pajhwok Afghan News, "7 suspects killed, 5 detained"
09/12/09, AFP, "US, Afghan troops launch operation"

properties.notes: Secretive units from U.S.  Special Operations forces killed Taliban fighters
properties.source: 12/29/09, The Pak Banker, "Pakistan: US Special operations forces expand in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Secretive units from U.S. Special Operations killed an unknown number of Taliban fighters
properties.source: 12/29/09, Daily The Pak Banker, "Pakistan: U.S. Special operations forces expand in Afghanistan"

properties.notes: U.S. hit wrong target in night raid
properties.source: 03/16/10, New York Times, "U.S. Is Reining in Special Forces"

properties.notes: American Special Ops, Afghan commandos and US DEA agents engaged in an operation in western Afghanistan in which they killed more than 12 insurgents; headed back to base, one helicopter crashed. Taliban claimed responsibility, US investigation opened
properties.types of units: Afghan commandos and US DEA agents
properties.source: 12/27/09, NBC News: Today, "Deadliest day for the US in Afghanistan in more than four years when 14 are killed in two separate chopper crashes"

properties.what was employed: 4 X (guided bomb unit) GBU-38 from 2 X US F-15.
properties.notes: Target elimination
properties.source: accessed 9/15/2010  The Guardian - Afghanistan War Logs, "Top Taliban bombed"

properties.notes: Force fired upon civilian acting upon suspicions.  4 fired rounds, one of which wounded the man and another killing a civilian woman
properties.source: accessed 9/15/2010  The Guardian - Afghanistan War Logs, "Woman killed, man hurt, by special forces searchers"

properties.what was employed: 4 X (guided bomb unit) GBU-38 from 2 X US F-15.
properties.notes: Target elimination
properties.source: accessed 9/15/2010  The Guardian - Afghanistan War Logs, "Top Taliban bombed"

properties.what was employed: Nine mid- and senior-level Taliban, including Mullah Khan Mohammad
properties.notes: Special operators conducted series of night raids
properties.source: 05/03/10, The Times (London), German soldiers in line of fire

properties.notes: During a search, special operators killed 3 militants, including commander Baz Mohammud (responsible for abduction of 2 journalists in September 2009,1/6/10
properties.source: Xinhua

properties.notes: U.S. missions were made public as a psychological tactic designed to intimidate Taliban force
properties.source: 2/7/10, The Sunday Times Special forces assassins infiltrate Taliban stronghold in Afghanistan

properties.notes: Special operators allegedly removed bullets from bodies to cover up crimes after night raid; investigation started
properties.source: 04/06/10, International Herald Tribune, U.S. admits forces killed women

properties.what was employed: Drone aircraft, Hellfire missile, aerial rockets
properties.notes: Wrong people were targeted
properties.captured/wounded: Several women and 2 children, ages six and nine
properties.source: 02/22/10, Guardian, Afghan ministers voice anger; 03/16/10, New York Times, U.S. Is Reining in Special Forces

properties.notes: Workers in a Special Forces clinic helped an ANA hospital to provide surgery for a badly burned Afghan boy
properties.source: 3/5/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs Office, "Child receives life-changing surgery in Kandahar province"

properties.notes: Special Forces Operation Detachment Alpha team helped locals on a 20-day project to clean local waterways and also provided medical assistance to people living in the area
properties.source: 4/6/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "USSF assist local nationals in southern Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Special Forces medics treated a 10-year old Afghan who was brought to their firebase near Char Chine district
properties.source: 4/1/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Special Forces medics treat, medevac Afghan child"

properties.notes: Special Forces soldiers transported civilians from Nai Baghban, Uruzgan Province, to Kabul for medical care
properties.types of units: Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
properties.source: 4/1/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Special Forces help move Afghan patients"

properties.notes: Afghan National Security Forces, working with Special Forces counterparts, set up a medical clinic
properties.source: 4/6/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Afghan National Security Forces, Special Forces host clinic"

properties.notes: Music blasted "to piss off the Taliban"
properties.source: 04/08/10, The Age (Australia), "U.S. Fight Taliban"

properties.notes: Special Forces operating with increasing intensity "picking up or picking off insurgent leaders to weaken the Taliban in advance of major operations"
properties.source: 4/26/10, Boston Globe, "Elite US Forces Target Kandahar"

properties.notes: Special Forces soldiers, accompanied by Afghan National Police, provided medical, dental and veterinary care to villagers
properties.source: 4/21/10, USASOC News Service, "Medical outreach in Shoragaz Village"

properties.notes: Special Forces Operational Detachment Alpha team members helped set up a government-led medical seminar
properties.types of units: Government of Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
properties.source: 4/5/10, ISAF Public Affairs, "Medics Teach Afghans to Help Themselves"

properties.notes: Special Forces conducted a three-day veterinary and medical outreach program
properties.source: 4/7/10, ISAF Joint Command-Afghanistan Public Affairs, "Special Forces conclude veterinary mission in Uruzgan province"

properties.notes: Special Operations killed Taliban fighters
properties.source: 04/09/10, BBC Monitoring South Asia, "US special forces kill three Taliban"

properties.notes: Afghans, with support from United States Special Forces, began broadcasting from a new radio station.
properties.source: 4/23/03, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Afghans stand up new radio station In Zabul Province"

properties.notes: Afghan National Security Forces, advised and assisted by U.S. Special Forces, distributed seed packets and bags of di-ammonium phosphate fertilizer to farmers
properties.source: 4/23/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Afghans, U.S. SOF provide security, distribute aid'

properties.notes: Special operators killed Taliban commander Mullah Daud along with one of his bodyguards
properties.source: 4/29/10, Xinhua, "1st Ld Writethru: Taliban Key Commander Killed in N. Afghanistan"

properties.notes: ANP, members of the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, U.S. Special Operations Forces and Oshay village elders gathered to discuss governance and future projects in the area.
properties.types of units: Afghan National Police, members of the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
properties.source: 5/3/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "Special Operations Forces distribute seeds at Shura"

properties.notes: Training Afghan National Army Special Forces in eight-week counterinsurgency program
properties.source: 05/27/10, Army Times, No easy task

properties.militants killed: 8, including Taliban commander Qari Shamsuddin, according to U.S. military
properties.civilians killed: 9, including Habibuddin, 16, son of Rafiuddin Kushkaki, according to Afghan villagers
properties.notes: House raid in Surkhrod.
properties.source: 05/24/10, Los Angeles Times, Two outlooks collide in the Afghan night

properties.notes: Members of the Afghan National Armys 8th Commando Kandak, advised and assisted by U.S. Special Operations Forces, provided medical care, focusing on preventative medicine and hygiene while treating more than 50 children and 10 adults.
properties.source: 6/7/10, ISAF Joint Command-Afghanistan, "Combined force provides medical care in Kandahar"

properties.militants killed: killed or captured 235 insurgent leaders, killed 1066 insurgents
properties.notes: U.S. special operations task force in Afghanistan has made its priority the disruption and dismantlement of the Haqqani network (a Pashtun insurgent group active in eastern Afghanistan led by Jalaluddin Haqqani); task force has about 5,000 personnel; in 90 days preceding 30 Aug 10, conducted over 500 missions
properties.source: 9/20/10, Army Times, "The Deadliest Insurgents JSOC Task Force Battles Haqqani Militants"
properties.u.s. personnel killed: Chief Special Warfare Operator (SEAL) Collin Thomas (18 Aug 10); Spc. Christopher Shane Wright (Ranger) (19 Aug 10); Sgt. Martin Anthony Lugo (Ranger) (19 Aug 10)

properties.notes: Weapons cache containing  10 rocket-propelled grenades, 12 SPG-9 recoilless rifle rounds, 200 7.62mm PKM machine-gun rounds and more than 20 107mm rockets and fuses safely destroyed by Speical Forces and ANSF
properties.source: 6/5/10, Pajhwok Afghan News, "Large weapons cache found in Uruzgan"

properties.notes: In response to a large explosion Wednesday evening at a wedding party, members of Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force  Afghanistan, along with Coalition forces, were called to provide medical assistance and security.
properties.source: 6/11/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "U.S. Special Forces treat Afghans wounded at wedding party"

properties.notes: The Afghan National Police, assisted by international security forces, destroyed an improvised explosive device planted in a soccer field in an effort of ANP with Special Operations to improve safety and security for residents of Kandahar province.
properties.source: 7/7/10, ISAF Command Public Affairs, "Afghan, International Forces find IED, protect children in Kandahar"

properties.notes: Special Forces suposedly raided home of Ahghan business man Haji Mohammad Zahir.
properties.source: 06/08/10 Afghanistan Television, "US forces reportedly raid businessman house in Afghan south"

properties.notes: Members of a U.S. Special Operations team delivered enough supplies and classroom furniture to outfit 90 students at an Afghan school in northern Kandahar province as part of an ongoing civil affairs initiative to assist local Afghan citizens with security, governance, and development.
properties.source: 7/12/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "U.S. Special Operations Teams deliver goods, double-up Afghan schools occupancy rate in Kandahar"

properties.notes: Forces located and destroyed two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) placed on a highway
properties.source: 7/13/10,US Fed News, "Afghan, US Forces Destroy Roadside Bombs In Zabul"

properties.notes: Over 500 pounds of explosive material was found along with tools for manufacturing improvised explosive devices (IEDs); all material, including a motorcycles rigged with explosives, was destroyed by the combined force
properties.source: 7/15/10,US Fed News, "Afghan, US Special Forces Destroy Insurgent Munitions"

properties.types of units: 1st Battalion, 3rd Special Forces Group (Airborne,Not available,0,2,0,0,Not available,Two Special Forces soldiers from Fort Bragg died Thursday in Afghanistan when their vehicle struck a bomb during a combat reconnaissance patrol,8/1/10
properties.source: ""2 Special Forces soldiers killed in Afghanistan"""

properties.notes: Afghan government officials and Afghan National Army Special Forces joined U.S. Special Forces in an operation Aug. 8 to assess the security of the main route leading from Kandahar City to the Khakrez District Center determining additional checkpoints are needed for security.
properties.types of units: Afghan government officials, Afghan National Army Special Forces
properties.source: 8/16/10, Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force  Afghanistan Media Operations Center, "Afghan Leaders partner with U.S. SOF to improve route security"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Operations Forces medics provided life saving care to an Afghan boy after a farming accident and arranged a medevac to to a nearby Coalition forward surgical team for treatment.
properties.source: 8/16/10, Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force  Afghanistan Media Operations Center, "ANA, coalition forces donate blood; provide life-saving care to Afghan boy in farming accident"

properties.notes: Forces conducted a joint sweeps recovering large caches of firearms
properties.types of units: Coalition Troops, Afghan National Army troops
properties.source: 8/9/10,Pajhwok Afghan News, "Seven suspects killed, five detained"

properties.notes: US forces ambushed, two special operators awarded Silver Stars
properties.captured/wounded: One U.S. soldier, three Afghan soldiers
properties.source: 08/16/10, AP, "Special Forces;" 08/16/10, CNN

properties.notes: U.S. Special Forces medical personnel medically evacuated a local civilian man after he was brought to a fire base in the area with near-fatal wounds.
properties.source: 8/26/10, Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force  Afghanistan Media Operations Center, "U.S. Special Forces medics save injured man"

properties.notes: USSF team treated water wells and kariz systems in four different villages and treated a total of 200 patients in a 48-hour period with medicine from the Mirwais Hospital in Kandahar City.
properties.source: 8/31/10, CJSOTF-A Media Center, "District Governor, U.S. Special Forces react quickly to water-borne illnesses in east Kandahar"

properties.notes: Forces found and destroyed a large weapons cache
properties.types of units: 5th Commando Kandak, Drug Enforcement Agency agents, Afghan National Interdiction Unit

properties.notes: Ongoing operation as of September 29.
properties.source: 9/26/10, New York Times, "American and Afghan Troops Begin Combat for Kandahar"

properties.notes: Search for a British aid worker and 3 Afghan co-workers kidnapped at gunpoint while traveling in convoy.
properties.source: 27/9/10, Guardian, "US forces join search for British woman kidnapped in Afghanistan

properties.notes: Afghan National Army Special Forces and U.S. Special Forces members provided veterinarian care during a Village Medical Outreach Program event Oct. 23, treating more than 162 animals with various ailments in the Khas Uruzgan district.
properties.source: 11/1/10, Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force- Afghanistan Media Operations Center, "ANA and US Special Forces members help treat village animals"

properties.notes: U.S. Special Operations Forces helped establish the radio network throughout southern Afghanistan and provided technical support to Afghan radio announcers.
properties.types of units: International Security Forces, Afghan district and provincial leaders
properties.source: 7/12/10, CJSOTF-A Public Affairs, "US supported radio network connects Afghan citizens, leaders in southern Afghanistan"

properties.notes: Forces raided a home and announced that they'd killed three suspected militants; the next morning, hundreds of people blocked the highway nearby, protesting that the young men were college students home for the holy month of Ramadan
properties.source: 25 August 2010NPR: All Things Considered "Deadly U.S. Raid Sparks Furor Among Afghan Civilians"

properties.notes: Teams of three to five soldiers, supported by Black Hawk MH-60K helicopters, searched for Osama bin Laden.
properties.source: 10/1/01, Herald-Sun, "Elite Forces Slip Over Border"
